oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Edith Scott Coll Memory Book_027 p. 12a
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photographs and captions from Miss Edith Scott's Memory Book, started July 1957. Her ancestors included the Scott, Deaderick, Crozier, Ramsey, Anderson and Alexander families. Francis Alexander Ramsey Scott (1827-1909) married Margaretta Frances Deaderick (1833-1909) in 1857. They were the parents of eleven children, including daughter Miss Edith Scott (1878-1971). Caption information appears below in the Full Text field.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Photographs; Scrapbooks; Families; History; Mantels; Fireplaces; Wallpapers;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number if available and provide a brief description of the photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Here is a picture of the mantel at Cedar Grove, which Sister Ret took with her camera. My brother, John, who was an architect was really an artist in many lines. He admired this mantel very much and particularly wanted its picture. I have tried to find a picture of an open fireplace to go in it, but have not succeeded yet - but I shall keep on trying. I think it was Mr. Ledgerwood, when living in the house, plastered up the fire place in this way. I wonder if the large room could have possibily been heated with that very small grate. When Dr. and Mrs. Ogle lived there they tore this away and made an open fire place.
